news.title: Best Buy beats on earnings and revenue, as computing and phone sales grow
news.summary: Best Buy beat Wall Street's fourth-quarter earnings and revenue estimates. The company's computing and phone sales increased. Best Buy also reported better-than-expected holiday sales.

news.title: Trump's Mexico tariffs could raise produce prices in the next few days, Target CEO says
news.summary: President Donald Trump's tariffs on Mexico could raise prices on strawberries, avocados and bananas. Target CEO Brian Cornell said the tariffs could be in place as early as next week.

news.title: Pro-Trump techies enraged by president's crypto reserve announcement, causing early rift
news.summary: Some of President Trump's most vocal supporters in tech took to social media to slam his latest proposal for a crypto strategic reserve. The White House has yet to comment on the proposal.

news.title: Bitcoin erases all of its gain that followed Trump's crypto reserve announcement
news.summary: Bitcoin fails to recover the $85,000 level, where it traded before President Donald Trump's announcement of a U.S. crypto reserve sent it soaring.

news.title: Tesla's worst month since 2022 coincided with Elon Musk's first full month in White House
news.summary: Tesla shares plunged 28% in February, their worst month since December 2022. Tesla shares fell 28% last month, the worst month for the automaker since December.

news.title: I’m 69 and only have $121,000 in my 401(k). How can I repair the damage of the past?
news.summary: “I plan to work and contribute to a 401(k) in addition to a stock-purchasing plan for a few more years,” she says.

news.title: Nvidia’s stock is doing things not seen in nearly a decade — and that’s good news
news.summary: Bernstein analyst looks at several valuation metrics that are near 10-year lows. The analyst deemed Nvidia’s stock “increasingly attractive”

news.title: Big Oil isn’t big on ‘drill, baby, drill’ — turning Trump to Canada and Greenland
news.summary: U.S. oil companies see stock buybacks and dividend hikes as more attractive than boosting production. U.S.-based oil companies are looking for ways to boost production rather than boost profits.

news.title: Oil prices extend drop sparked by OPEC+ plan to boost output
news.summary: Oil futures fell Tuesday, building on losses seen the previous session. Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and its allies said they would proceed with plans to unwind some production curbs in April.

news.title: The U.S. dollar is still the world’s currency — but maybe not for much longer
news.summary: Concerns are rising about the sustainability of U.S. government debt and spending. Concerns are also rising about how much money is being spent on defense.
